thread.title: The Huddle Week 8: Breaking down the big games of the week
thread.title_full: The Huddle Week 8: Breaking down the big games of the week

title: The Huddle Week 8: Breaking down the big games of the week
text:
The Huddle Week 8: Breaking down the big games of the week - WCIV-TV | ABC News 4 - Charleston News, Sports, Weather Member Center: The Huddle Week 8: Breaking down the big games of the week Posted: Updated: 
MOUNT PLEASANT, S.C. (WCIV) -- ABC News 4's Scott Eisberg and the Post and Courier's Andrew Miller make their picks on the biggest games of the week in high school football. How will they fare? Tune in each week to find out! 
Ashley Ridge vs. Bluffton Eisberg: Big test for the Swamp Foxes, but they will squeak by a tough Bluffton offense. Ashley Ridge, 28-20. 
Miller: Ashley Ridge quarterback Steven Duncan can play. He will be tough to stop. Ashley Ridge, 31-17. 
Goose Creek at Cane Bay Eisberg: I'm on the Cobra train now, very impressed with what coach Russell Zehr has done with this squad. Cane Bay, 31-17. 
Miller: Not ready to jump off the Goose Creek bandwagon just yet. Goose Creek, 24-20. 
Fort Dorchester at Colleton County Eisberg: Patriots continue to dominate. No problems with Colleton County on this night. Fort Dorchester, 52-14. 
Miller: Two great sophomores on the field in Colleton County WR Justin Williams and Fort Dorchester QB Dakereon Joyner. Fort Dorchester, 42-17. 
James Island at West Ashley Eisberg: Great rivalry, great game. West Ashley is coming off Monday night game, and fatigue will be a factor. James Island, 21-14. 
Miller: Wildcats will be tired after chasing Wando WR Ortre Smith, but they'll have enough to beat James Island. West Ashley, 23-19. 
Wando at Stratford Eisberg: Stratford is struggling and Wando has dynamic playmakers in Kevin Brown, Ortre Smith and Bailey Hart. Wando, 27-10. 
Miller: Stratford will have its hands full, but defense will make enough plays to win. Stratford, 31-28. 
Berkeley at Orangeburg-Wilkinson Eisberg: Berkeley fell hard to Hilton Head, but I still have faith in the Stags. Berkeley, 21-14. 
Miller: Orangeburg-Wilkinson will come up with enough stops on fourth down for the win. O-W, 33-19. 
Tune in next week to see how the Miller and Eisberg fared and see next week's picks. 
Each Friday night, ABC News 4 streams a TruMoo Friday Night Rivals game of the week online. The coverage starts at 7 p.m. on MyTV Charleston and abcnews4.com. With the rain creating problems around the Lowcountry and changing football schedules, the Game of the Week has been moved to next week. Stay with ABC News 4 to find out when it will be broadcast. 
Then after the game, on air and online, Scott Eisberg and Daren Stoltzfus breaks down all the games of the night in the high school football special, TruMoo Friday Night Rivals driven by Lowcountry Chevy Dealers, during the 11 p.m. news. 
Full slate of games for Week 8: 
Ashley Ridge at Bluffton Fort Dorchester at Colleton CountyGoose Creek at Cane BayBerkeley at Orangeburg-Wilkinson
